reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: When we did construction in our new home, the electrician put another brand of switches in and said they were fine. I have to disagree with him so I bought this brand and I’m so happy I did my lights don’t flicker. I have some switches on dimmers some without from now on I will never use another light switch besides this brand.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2025
reviews.title: Light switches

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: Easy to install and looks nice. To me it looks very modern. It's definitely an upgrade to our home. Installs like any other switch. I did run out and get different caps because I felt the ones this came with weren't adequate, however that's just me being technical. They are your typical everyday caps that are in every home. Dims well and has a small light bar on the side that looks slick. Zero noise when turning it on and it truly feels well built. Fits a little snug compared to other switches but you'll just need to menuver it to the plate. I put it in a four plate outlet and did just fine.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2024
reviews.title: Works Well

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: These are easy to install and look great as I get my home ready to sell. The only thing is the direction of the how you use the switch is weird to me. To turn the light on, you push in the bottom of the switch - meaning when the lights are on the top of the toggle is sticking out. This may just be a user preference, but I would prefer to hit the top of the toggle to turn the light on as it makes more sense to me. This can be remedied by removing the toggle plate and switching the position, but then the Lutron logo is upside down. As other reviewers said, the switch makes a nice click when it turns on/off and I like that. One other thing to mention is that my switch boxes are pretty small and full of wires bc this is an old house, so it was difficult for me to make everything fit but that's just unique to my house.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022
reviews.title: Easy to Install, Look Great, but Switch Use Direction is Weird

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: I have installed Leviton switches throughout my house but I figured for my family room I would install the Lutron as they seem nicer (to me at least). While installing the 3-way, I was tightening the screw on the hot wire and the switch snapped in half (the black housing in the back) rendering the switch useless. I have replaced all the switches in my house and not once did I run into this issue with any of the other Lutron or Leviton switches. With that being said, I will be sticking with Leviton. Lutron, while looking and feeling nicer than Leviton seems more fragile.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2021
reviews.title: Snapped in half while installing

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: We needed a variety of styles (4 ways, on/off, dimmers) for our kitchen/hallway and lutron provided the rocker style in all of them and all were matching white (it's amazing how white varies between manufactures). We have all lutron switches in the kitchen and hallway and will slowly replace all our others- easy to install and works great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2021
reviews.title: Matches great

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: I bought 2 of these switches. I spent 2 hours trouble shooting my wiring after installation because I couldn’t get the lights to turn on properly. When the wiring kept checking out I finally started trouble shooting the switches with a meter and one of the positions was open and it would never work. The other switch’s body fell apart after I rewired it a couple of times when I was troubleshooting. Would never by these again.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021
reviews.title: Defective product, poor quality

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Claro On/Off Switch, 15-Amp/3-Way, CA-3PS-WH, White
reviews.text: I am wiring our new “CAT5 cottage” on the Texas Gulf Coast using Lutron dimmers and switches, just like we have in our house in Houston. Lutron makes high quality switchgear, but like a lot of electrical stuff, the documentation is dumbed-down severely. Today I spend over an hour trying to make a 3-way circuit work using this switch with a Lutron dimmer at the other end. Turns-out that Lutron doesn’t put the “common” terminal in the same place as everybody else (alone, at one end of the switch), AND my switches DID NOT HAVE a different colored screw for common (all screws were brass colored). Apparently they ran-out of black screws at the factory in Korea. And (as noted in one of the QUESTIONS, the “common” is not marked on the body of the switch anywhere. The Lutron “common” terminal is (a) on the END with two terminals, AND (b) on the SIDE with two terminals. Once I figured that out (from the wiring diagram, NOT the installation instruction) it worked great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
reviews.title: WARNING: “Common” Terminal isn’t in the “common” place
